<Link id="l01116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1116"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Swift calling convention does not require we copy the sret argument</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1117"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// into %d0 for the return, and SRetReturnReg is not set for Swift.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1118"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1119"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ABI require that for returning structs by value we copy the sret argument</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1120"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// into %D0 for the return. Save the argument into a virtual register so that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1121"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we can access it from the return points.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1122"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1123"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Checking Function.hasStructRetAttr() here is insufficient because the IR</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1124"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// may not have an explicit sret argument. If MFI.CanLowerReturn is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1125"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// false, then an sret argument may be implicitly inserted in the SelDAG. In</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1126"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// either case MFI-&gt;setSRetReturnReg() will have been called.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1127"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SRetReg = MFI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/m68kmachinefunctioninfo/#a86028cbccf87f3c198d7369ea421d334">getSRetReturnReg</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1128"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ??? Can i just move this to the top and escape this explanation?</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1129"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When we have both sret and another return value, we should use the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1130"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// original Chain stored in RetOps&#91;0&#93;, instead of the current Chain updated</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1131"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in the above loop. If we only have sret, RetOps&#91;0&#93; equals to Chain.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1132"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1133"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For the case of sret and another return value, we have</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1134"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   Chain&#95;0 at the function entry</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1135"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   Chain&#95;1 = getCopyToReg(Chain&#95;0) in the above loop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1136"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we use Chain&#95;1 in getCopyFromReg, we will have</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1137"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   Val = getCopyFromReg(Chain&#95;1)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1138"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   Chain&#95;2 = getCopyToReg(Chain&#95;1, Val) from below</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1139"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1140"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// getCopyToReg(Chain&#95;0) will be glued together with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1141"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// getCopyToReg(Chain&#95;1, Val) into Unit A, getCopyFromReg(Chain&#95;1) will be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1142"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in Unit B, and we will have cyclic dependency between Unit A and Unit B:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1143"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   Data dependency from Unit B to Unit A due to usage of Val in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1144"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     getCopyToReg(Chain&#95;1, Val)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1145"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   Chain dependency from Unit A to Unit B</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1146"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1147"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// So here, we use RetOps&#91;0&#93; (i.e Chain&#95;0) for getCopyFromReg.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1148"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64isellowering-cpp/#a51cb24bd3e700fcf2f93d1afbb555a16">SDValue</a> Val = DAG.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag/#a6551350658729b36c93362fcff19abab">getCopyFromReg</a>(RetOps&#91;0&#93;, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>, SRetReg,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1167"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DAG.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag/#abad5b17501ce8972fb04a149611e7177">getNode</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68kisd/#a5d785b7c28047e4e75d1fed254de7a5ead7fa9da10b119eb169b7ae6e431c3321">M68kISD::RET</a>, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>, MVT::Other, RetOps);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1168"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1169"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1170"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1171"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                Fast Calling Convention (tail call) implementation</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1172"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1173"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1174"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  Like std call, callee cleans arguments, convention except that ECX is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1175"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  reserved for storing the tail called function address. Only 2 registers are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1176"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  free for argument passing (inreg). Tail call optimization is performed</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1177"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  provided:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1178"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                &#42; tailcallopt is enabled</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1179"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                &#42; caller/callee are fastcc</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1180"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  On M68k&#95;64 architecture with GOT-style position independent code only</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1181"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  local (within module) calls are supported at the moment. To keep the stack</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1182"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  aligned according to platform abi the function GetAlignedArgumentStackSize</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1183"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  ensures that argument delta is always multiples of stack alignment. (Dynamic</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1184"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  linkers need this - darwin&#39;s dyld for example) If a tail called function</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1185"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  callee has more arguments than the caller the caller needs to make sure that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1186"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  there is room to move the RETADDR to. This is achieved by reserving an area</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1187"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  the size of the argument delta right after the original RETADDR, but before</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1188"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  the saved framepointer or the spilled registers e.g. caller(arg1, arg2)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1189"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  calls callee(arg1, arg2,arg3,arg4) stack layout:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1190"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    arg1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1191"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    arg2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1192"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    RETADDR</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1193"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    &#91; new RETADDR</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1194"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      move area &#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1195"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    (possible EBP)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1196"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    ESI</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1197"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    EDI</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1198"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    local1 ..</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1199"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1200"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Make the stack size align e.g 16n + 12 aligned for a 16-byte align</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1201"><Highlight kind="comment">/// requirement.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3067"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// which to mark. Figure out whether SelectItr should have had a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3100"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/dwarf-linker/#a463a58e257d5f6fb2c39eb9a2474fc24ac2e06fc138163b7095fa483616a0a47a">DebugLoc</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a> = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.getDebugLoc();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3101"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3102"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// To &quot;insert&quot; a SELECT&#95;CC instruction, we actually have to insert the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3103"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// diamond control-flow pattern.  The incoming instruction knows the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3104"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// destination vreg to set, the condition code register to branch on, the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3105"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// true/false values to select between, and a branch opcode to use.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3106"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a8472e46f9e4db168c5610ecdfb05dbaf">BasicBlock</a> &#42;BB = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a>-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#a4874816314c3308be0bf1e71de2078d8">getBasicBlock</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3107"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#aaba82c71ffdca966cad10eae0992fff9">MachineFunction::iterator</a> It = ++<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a>-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-node-impl/#af719fc783be6589465137d997701a432">getIterator</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3108"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3109"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  ThisMBB:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3110"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3111"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   TrueVal = ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3112"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   cmp ccX, r1, r2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3113"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   bcc Copy1MBB</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3114"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   fallthrough --&gt; Copy0MBB</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3115"><Highlight kind="normal">  MachineBasicBlock &#42;ThisMBB = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3116"><Highlight kind="normal">  MachineFunction &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a> = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a>-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#acf6442108e21e7e5379feb8962de65b7">getParent</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3117"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3118"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This code lowers all pseudo-CMOV instructions. Generally it lowers these</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3119"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// as described above, by inserting a MBB, and then making a PHI at the join</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3120"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// point to select the true and false operands of the CMOV in the PHI.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3121"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3122"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The code also handles two different cases of multiple CMOV opcodes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3123"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in a row.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3124"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3125"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Case 1:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3126"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In this case, there are multiple CMOVs in a row, all which are based on</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3127"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the same condition setting (or the exact opposite condition setting).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3128"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In this case we can lower all the CMOVs using a single inserted MBB, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3129"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// then make a number of PHIs at the join point to model the CMOVs. The only</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3130"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// trickiness here, is that in a case like:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3131"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3132"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// t2 = CMOV cond1 t1, f1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3133"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// t3 = CMOV cond1 t2, f2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3134"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3135"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// when rewriting this into PHIs, we have to perform some renaming on the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3136"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// temps since you cannot have a PHI operand refer to a PHI result earlier</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3137"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in the same block.  The &quot;simple&quot; but wrong lowering would be:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3138"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3139"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// t2 = PHI t1(BB1), f1(BB2)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3140"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// t3 = PHI t2(BB1), f2(BB2)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3141"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3142"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// but clearly t2 is not defined in BB1, so that is incorrect. The proper</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3143"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// renaming is to note that on the path through BB1, t2 is really just a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3144"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// copy of t1, and do that renaming, properly generating:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3145"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3146"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// t2 = PHI t1(BB1), f1(BB2)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3147"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// t3 = PHI t1(BB1), f2(BB2)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3148"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3149"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Case 2, we lower cascaded CMOVs such as</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3150"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3151"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   (CMOV (CMOV F, T, cc1), T, cc2)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3152"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3153"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to two successives branches.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3154"><Highlight kind="normal">  MachineInstr &#42;CascadedCMOV = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3155"><Highlight kind="normal">  MachineInstr &#42;LastCMOV = &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3156"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#a3ae7fc35b1e164744d5f085ff1e84039">M68k::CondCode</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a77c69067ae8279bc00ab8757731e90d7">CC</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#a3ae7fc35b1e164744d5f085ff1e84039">M68k::CondCode</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.getOperand(3).getImm());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3157"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#a3ae7fc35b1e164744d5f085ff1e84039">M68k::CondCode</a> OppCC = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#a876bb5be568d372d0a658d2ea5927b74">M68k::GetOppositeBranchCondition</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a77c69067ae8279bc00ab8757731e90d7">CC</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3158"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> NextMIIt =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3159"><Highlight kind="normal">      std::next(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3160"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3161"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check for case 1, where there are multiple CMOVs with the same condition</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
